intro: Myricanthe discolor, commonly known as the variable myricanthe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Myricaceae, which includes species commonly referred to as candlewoods. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Myricanthe discolor is often found in moist, woodland habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
